alert.note: Alert for Coastal Nassau (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 2:59PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Nassau, eastern Camden and south central Glynn Counties through 345 PM EST... At 259 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hilliard, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Kingsland, Brunswick, Fernandina Beach, Kings Bay Base, Yulee, High Point, Dungeness, Cumberland Island and Harrietts Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.
